content.description: Sit start with good edges. Climb straight up through generous edges to reach an easy mantel. Also, this is the downclimb that I used.
content.protection: A pad. It has a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the blunt northeast arete of Precipice.

content.description: Sit start on a pair of good edges. From there, pull up to and match on another great edge, follow to a right hand pinch-edge, then a shallow, left hand dimple, use a pair of edges on the slab to pull up high to another edge and the better holds above, and walk up the remaining slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a good landing, but there is a rock behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the center of Precipice's northwest face.

content.description:
Sit start with a thin left hand edge and a good right hand edge. From there, gain another thin left hand edge, achieve decent footing, then reach the jug right hand, traverse into

Soft Glow

, and finish with an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. There is a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the northernmost section of Precipice's east face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the jug. From there, gain a left hand pinch on the arete, achieve a high left smear, gain a right hand edge, follow to a great teardrop edge, and finish up the remaining features to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The immediate landing is good, but there is a rock behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the north side of Precipice.
